Use PreferenceKey (Get Offset of ScrollView in SwiftUI Efficently)

⇐ Back to home

Updated for Swift 5.4, and Xcode 12.5.

Checkout source code from Github

Topics

Pass data from a child view to its parent view.

Codes

Define a PreferenceKey struct

import SwiftUI

struct OffsetPreferenceKey: PreferenceKey {
  static var defaultValue: CGFloat = .zero
  static func reduce(value: inout CGFloat, nextValue: () -> CGFloat) {}
}

Read the offset of a ScrollView real-time

import SwiftUI

struct ContentView: View {
    
    @State var offset: CGFloat = 0
    
    var body: some View {
        VStack {
            Text("Offset is \(offset)")
            ScrollView {
                Text("This is a text view in scroll view")
                    .background(
                        GeometryReader { proxy in
                            Color.clear
                                .preference(
                                    key: OffsetPreferenceKey.self,
                                    value: proxy.frame(in: .named("scroll")).minY
                                )
                        }
                    )
            }
            .onPreferenceChange(OffsetPreferenceKey.self, perform: { value in
                offset = value
            })
            .frame(maxWidth: .infinity)
            .background(Color.yellow)
            .coordinateSpace(name: "scroll")
        }
    }
}

Screenshots

Key Points

  1. Write value by preference modifier in child view
  2. Read value by onPreferenceChange modifier in parent view
